p: The highest concentrations of quercetin, quercetin 3-β- d-glucoside, luteolin, and kaempferol in cv. ‘NHRDF Red’ (11,885.025 mg/kg), ‘Hissar-2′. (1432.875 mg/kg), ‘Pusa Riddhi’ (1669.925 mg/kg) and ‘Bhima Shakti’ (709.975 mg/kg), were found in dry skin of 15 Indian cultivars onion when their flavonoid concentration, total phenolic content (TPC) and total flavonoid content (TFC) were examined. In addition, cv. ‘NHRDF Red’ had the highest while cv ‘Bhima Shubhra’ had the lowest TPC and TFC content (Sagar et al. 2020). Detailed constituents of A. cepa are shown in Table 1.
